@huangdx0726 Thank you very much for reporting this issue. 
The reason for this issue is that we'll add more content on Pulsar configure, Monitor, secure and troubleshooting. The content is under construction. So you could not click "Next" at the end of the page. When the content is ready, the link to "Next" works automatically.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47805623/72716858-ec6a6c80-3bad-11ea-9c39-a03ae0efb3c1.png)

You can get full information on the new Pulsar Functions structure at https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/4554

@merlimat, @jiazhai What can I do to avoid the risk of not having this pull-request included in 2.6.0? The best solution should be the one that would trigger a merge sooner than the moment when 2.6.0 is about to be released. Please let me know what should I do to make this happen. Thanks!

@gaoran10 Hi, go for it :).
@codelipenghui Thanks for your guidance, I've incorporated your comments as we discussed, PTAL

Update the Python API as well.
@tuteng PTAL, thank you.

@sijie I suggest @wolfstudy to change the default value of `maxUnackedMessagesPerSubscription` and `maxUnackMessagesPerConsumer` to `-1` in namespace policy, because `0` means disabled in broker.conf. Only non negative value can update policy when broker get policy update notifications. Please help take a look.

The OOM appear to be in reading from Bookkeeper and possibly the broker is issuing too many read requests at a time. We've had some limited success with the dispatcher throttling introduced in 2.5. Using both:
./bin/pulsar-admin namespaces set-dispatch-rate public/default \
  --msg-dispatch-rate 500 \
  --dispatch-rate-period 1
./bin/pulsar-admin namespaces set-subscription-dispatch-rate public/default \
  --msg-dispatch-rate 50 \
  --dispatch-rate-period 1
allows runs to not OOM most but not all of the time.

A rate limit is difficult to use as the number of topics and subscriptions will not be known and we would have to plan for the worst case scenario. 

One or more new limits on bookie parallel reads seem to be required?

Having the same issue with 2.5.0 standalone.

WS receives unexpected server response: 400 on connect.

`Param serviceUrl must not be blank.`

This is a complete blocker for anyone using WS. So reverting back to 2.4.2 is working.

@BlackJohnny Can you please rebase this pull request to latest master? Also it would be good to send the pull request from a non-master branch. The committers can help you rebase branch to latest master as needed.
if you are just using the helm charts, I don't think the changes to images will impact you. What are the errors you have encountered?

@Gray-Fullbuster 

1) what is your operating system?
2) what version of Pulsar are you using?

Besides that, I don't think that is a problem. It should be just a warning as it falls back to java code if the JNI library is not found.
@nareshgbhat I don't have any ARM64 machine to verify this. Do you know what version of Protobuf supports ARM64?

@frejonb I don't think python function supports this feature yet. 

@Anonymitaet we need to improve the documentation about this part.

The dead letter topic support in java functions also has one problem. #6101 is used for addressing the problem in java functions.

Python functions doesn't support this feature at all.

I meet this problem When i start bookkeeper.Then bookie can't start up.The following is the error message
[main] ERROR org.apache.bookkeeper.server.Main - Failed to build bookie server
java.io.IOException: Failed to load RocksDB JNI library 
		at org.apache.bookkeeper.bookie.storage.ldb.KeyValueStorageRocksDB.<init>(KeyValueStorageRocksDB.java:91) ~[org.apache.bookkeeper-bookkeeper-server-4.9.2.jar:4.9.3-SNAPSHOT]
		at org.apache.bookkeeper.bookie.storage.ldb.KeyValueStorageRocksDB.<init>(KeyValueStorageRocksDB.java:83) ~[org.apache.bookkeeper-bookkeeper-server-4.9.2.jar:4.9.3-SNAPSHOT]

@sijie The protobuf version 3.6 is officially supported.  We can help to get the ARM64 systems from Linaro side for CI (a developer cloud instance access) or else we can also help to test the same on ARM64 machines.

Related PRs:
https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/5865
https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/4053
